31055140.review: This "music video" is only a few minutes long, but as you can tell by my time spent, I've watched it several times. *SPOILER ALERT* There is something magical about watching the evolution of mankind told without words. We rise from the primordial soup as single pixels, develop into complex forms, take our first steps, show signs of intelligence and tower over the land as giants, only to return to the soup from which we came. Great stuff. Awesome experience worth watching over and over.

A short, incredible experience. Best played with open back headphones and (if you have one) an audio transducer to get the bass rattling the room in harmony with the oscillation of the cubes in-game.

If you have a headset, try this.

音楽とそれに合わせて動く不思議な四角形。

26547486.review:
GTX 970, Core i5 2500K, 16GB RAM

The music video runs smoothly on my hardware.

Now THIS is how a VR music video should be done.  Very neat geometric visualizations timed to the music, and the grandness of the ending is a great way to finish the experience.

26468244.review: This is absolutely marvelous, I would love to see more artists using this as means to showcase their work, it's like nothing I've seen before, it is totally next level.

26332271.review:
This is a great "first experience" game to introduce friends to VR with, since it requires no input and really shows off the immersiveness and the sense of scale that VR technology is capable of. It is beautiful and terrifying and pure magic to someone who has never seen VR before. It has zero replay value and it's not a game, but it's free and pretty incredible for what it is.

And no, it does not "require the use of a keyboard and mouse" like it says for some reason.

26300587.review: This revives the demoscene and brings it into the new dimension - literally :)

26276909.review: nice VR experiance but not more

26139019.review: Surge is a brief VR experience set to music in a kind of non-interactive but still room-scalable music video. It's a neat idea but I can't help but wonder if it would have been better off as a complete album instead of a 5 minute experience. Still, the visuals were pretty cool, the music was alright, and it's a freebie to boot.

26100107.review: Short but good. Thank you for making.

26041026.review: Surge is nothing like i've ever seen before. This truly opened my eyes to the epic possibilities of VR. Surge is a beautiful dream. I'm hooked... i want more!!

Surge is basically a free 3D music video, which has a fantastic atmosphere that reacts to the beat. A great single time experience and perfect for demoing to anyone. It is on my rotation of games for everyone to try in VR. I highly recomended you try it!

25061714.review: I hope one day this is how all music videos are made.

24981221.review: Very impressive visuals and gives a great sense of scale, however the moving floor did make me feel slightly naucious. Well worth a try!

24960029.review: Great experience, highly recommended. The since of scale for some of the shots is breathtaking.

24825055.review: I think this was the first VR Experience I tried with my Vive. Basically, wow. It's like being inside a dream.

24802913.review: If you own a Vive or Oculus, this is simply a must have experience.

24751732.review: The ultimate VR  music video. I watch this first when i fire up my Vive and i show this to friends when i demo VR to them. I need more of these kinds of experiences.

24657483.review: This was my very first VR experience after hooking up my Vive. My reaction was followed with a smile as I uttered "this is gonna be freaking awesome"!

24618084.review:
This is such a great experience. It gave me the chills.
And on the second run, a teared up eye.

I definitely saw room for improvement, especially in menu navigation, and performance (which seemed worse in menus than the actual experience).

If you have seen some demos from the demo scene, this environment will definitely look familiar, but give a different perspective with such a big impact.
Really, well done. Now I just want to see more of this, and slightly more polished. I long for music videos like this now. And I could see myself chilling in a world like this for a long time, playing on repeat.

DEFINITELY try this out!

24617628.review: I really enjoyed this. I cant wait for more experiences like these to be created.

24442867.review: Very cool experience. Defeinatly shows the potential for music vidoes in VR. It's a little short but given that it's free, I can't really complain.

24417732.review: Very cool experience.  I'd really like to see more!

24415960.review: Un bijou ! Techniquement et artistiquement parfait, c'est une sompteuse démonstration de l'art de faire des films en VR. Indispensable, ça vous laissera bouche bée !

24400586.review:
The moment I finished watching this experiance I immediatly pressed play again, without thought. I had to get back into this rich and vivid world of sound and motion.

may I remind you this is FREE?

stop reading this and download it!

24389389.review:
Wow. A really impressive experience, I didn't want it to end. It's non interactive, you just watch this one. Great visuals with a nice soundtrack.

If you are prone to motion sickness though just a heads up there is a part where the floor starts moving that may trigger. I was caught off caught and lost my footing for a second so I can only imagine it would be worse for those that get nausea from VR.

If you know any others like this please tell me in a comment below, thank you!

Major kudos to the developer!

23208758.review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
 [*] - Stunning visuals
 [*] - Visuals perfectly synchronized with the music.
[/list]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
 [*] - The auto-locomotion feels wrong, it made me feel a little woozy. I think the experience could be improved by completely disabling it.
 [*] - Gaze-controlled menu.
[/list]

Overall, a beautiful short VR experiment with a lot of work put in it. It's free, so you should definitely check it out!

UPDATE: Sync issues for the Vive have just been fixed, so it works great now! Thanks to the creator for a quick response to user feedback on this.

23196424.review:
Holy amazeballs this was so surreal and crazy awesome. Do recommend. There's a sync issue on high resolution, though, so play it at medium. Otherwise the animation drags and the song cuts out halfway through.

Really cool stuff, though. I look forward to more like it.

(Played on Rift CV1 with GTX970)

EDIT: An update has fixed the sync issue when playing on High Resolution. Now it's perfect! Thanks!

23196196.review:
Animations and music are no longer sync'd. :(

The delay isn't quite as bad if I lower the resolution to medium, but even then, there's still a noticable delay. Don't remember experiencing that on the DK2 version.

Definltely an objectively awesome song, with amazing visuals provided for free, so I definitely still recommend it, but be warned, the visual glitches and desync can detract from the original experience quite a bit.

UPDATE: Devs released a fix pretty quicky. Two words to describe the video: fucking glorious.

23196195.review: Works very well for the rift and is amazing walking around in the Vive. (if you can handle the moving floor) Want to see the wand controllers on Vive version though.. Kind of like a ghost of the wands like in "THE BLU" so I can wave my hands to the beat!

23195691.review: This was my first VR music video experience and I left really satisfied with the time I spent experiencing it. I could really see myself chilling to this after a strenous day at work. MOAR please!  :-)

23194602.review:
Compared to the pre-recorded video in steam, the 3D video was moving slower so the music finished half-way through it. 

Otherwise, I found it quite boring, there isn't much to look at. But then, since I spent half the time looking around to see if something else was hapening elsewhere, it might be good thing that the little action there was was slow.

Overall, it's an interesting view of what music videos can become, but I can't say that this one was a good example. Try it if you want, it's free and short so you won't lose money nor time, and maybe you'll like it (it's art after all, so it's very subjective)

23191496.review: This is an amazing VR experience. It is short but it takes an important first step in making a music video actually work in VR. Now I have seen other music videos in VR like the Run the Jewels video which is part of Wevr Transport. Even though that video was also great it had a fixed camera and it felt more like watching a 360 video(which is basically what it was) and less like I was actually in that space. Surge is different in that it is made in the Unreal Engine and has positional tracking and the whole package which means you feel like you are actually there. Couple that with amazing set pieces which go along perfectly with the music and cram it into a short music video and you have Surge. Its free so I definitively recommend you try it out.

23191030.review: What a phenomenal preview of the future. That was beautiful and so very immersive. I can't wait until all music videos are like this.

23190862.review:
Quite good really. Nice little expirence & free. 

Would be great to see something like this that had a VR visulisation of tracks you play from your own list. Difference scenes etc.

All in all great for what is a very young VR industry.

39461213.review:
Surge is a VR music video.  Worked on my system, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  Short music video, no interaction. 

Try it and delete it.
